docs.snippet: We tried to exempt cigars,'' John Kennedy told me in early 1961 when I brought him the order that imposed an embargo on trade with Cuba, ''but the cigar manufacturers in Tampa objected. I guess we're out of luck.''     He was right -- I was out of...
docs.lead_paragraph: We tried to exempt cigars,'' John Kennedy told me in early 1961 when I brought him the order that imposed an embargo on trade with Cuba, ''but the cigar manufacturers in Tampa objected. I guess we're out of luck.'' He was right -- I was out of luck. But not the president. Somehow he never seemed to run out of Cuban cigars.
docs.abstract: Richard Goodwin Op-Ed article argues for end to US economic embargo against Cuba; says Pres John F Kennedy, under whom the embargo was imposed, hoped to lay groundwork for some rapprochement with Cuba before he was killed; says embargo has only strengthened rule of Pres Fidel Castro; says opening Cuba to flow of American business and travelers would have wholly salutary effect on life of country (M)

headline.main: President Kennedy's Plan for Peace with Cuba

docs.snippet: ON a breezy Saturday afternoon, Rawle George rode his bike into Prospect Park, weaved around the families barbecuing hot dogs, and coasted past a crowded Little League game. Stopping in a field of people flying kites and playing Frisbee, he scanned...
docs.lead_paragraph: ON a breezy Saturday afternoon, Rawle George rode his bike into Prospect Park, weaved around the families barbecuing hot dogs, and coasted past a crowded Little League game. Stopping in a field of people flying kites and playing Frisbee, he scanned the scene until his eye hooked onto one object: a white ball being kicked into the air. Mr. George pedaled over to an archipelago of backpacks and leaned down his bike. A few faces in the soccer game were familiar, but he couldn't tell who was on which team or where the boundaries might be.
docs.abstract: Scene at pickup soccer games in Brooklyn's Prospect Park, which has become longstanding institution despite fact that there are no starting or ending times, no referees or uniforms and most players do not know score or names of all their teammates, whose ethnic backgrounds are widely diverse; photos (L)

docs.snippet: Brazil's Coach Wanderley Luxemburgo is planning more changes for Brazil's World Cup qualifying game in Paraguay today. Luxemburgo is expected to make at least five changes from the lineup that struggled in a 1-1 tie with Uruguay last month at home....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's Coach Wanderley Luxemburgo is planning more changes for Brazil's World Cup qualifying game in Paraguay today. Luxemburgo is expected to make at least five changes from the lineup that struggled in a 1-1 tie with Uruguay last month at home. Luxemburgo is expected to play Sao Paulo's Edmilson and Palmeiras' Roque Junior in an untried central defensive partnership, and field a five-man midfield.
docs.abstract: Brazil's Coach Wanderley Luxemburgo is planning changes for Brazil's World Cup qualifying game in Paraguay (S)

docs.snippet: Carlos Paredes and Jorge Campos each scored as Paraguay stunned Brazil, 2-1, tonight in the fifth round of World Cup soccer qualifying play in Latin America.    It was the first time Paraguay defeated Brazil in World Cup qualifying.
docs.lead_paragraph: Carlos Paredes and Jorge Campos each scored as Paraguay stunned Brazil, 2-1, tonight in the fifth round of World Cup soccer qualifying play in Latin America. It was the first time Paraguay defeated Brazil in World Cup qualifying.
docs.abstract: Paraguay defeats Brazil, 2-1, in fifth round of World Cup soccer qualifying play in Latin America (S)

headline.main: Brazil Soccer Team Upset by Paraguay

docs.snippet: The dream of a Marxist-Leninist revolution remains improbably alive amid the rolling cattle pastures and steamy coca fields of southern Colombia.     Guerrillas in crisp, starched fatigues wear Che Guevara buttons, strum old leftist jeremiads on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The dream of a Marxist-Leninist revolution remains improbably alive amid the rolling cattle pastures and steamy coca fields of southern Colombia. Guerrillas in crisp, starched fatigues wear Che Guevara buttons, strum old leftist jeremiads on guitars and pledge to bring Yankee imperialism down to defeat once and for all. Three portraits of Lenin grace the press office of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, in this boisterous small ranching town, including one of the founder of the Soviet Union petting a kitten. The pitted roads that run through the countryside are spruced with signs that read ''No more torture'' and ''No More Gringo Military Advisers.''
docs.abstract: Dream of Marxist-Leninist revolution remains improbably alive amid rolling cattle pastures and steamy coca fields of southern Colombia, where guerrillas wear Che Guevara buttons and pledge to bring Yankee imperialism down to defeat once and for all; while other insurgencies in Central and South America have either laid down arms, been annhilated or remodeled themselves as moderate and democratic, Marxists in Colombia are fighting back history; are pushing around established army, battling right-wing paramilitary force and drawing US into growing military role; photos; map (M)

headline.main: Colombia's Rebels Keep the Marxist Faith

docs.snippet: After Sunday's 2-1 loss in San Jose, Costa Rica, left them in last place in the four-team group, the Americans find themselves in a precarious position only two games into qualifying matches for the 2002 World Cup.      Now it is virtually imperative...
docs.lead_paragraph: After Sunday's 2-1 loss in San Jose, Costa Rica, left them in last place in the four-team group, the Americans find themselves in a precarious position only two games into qualifying matches for the 2002 World Cup. Now it is virtually imperative for the Americans to win their three home matches -- against Barbados, Guatemala and Costa Rica. Two of the four teams will advance to a six-team regional final. Three nations from that group will advance to the finals in Japan and South Korea.
docs.abstract: Status of US men's World Cup soccer team following 2-1 loss to Costa Rica discussed (S)

headline.main: Tough Test Is Awaiting U.S. Men

docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil beat Argentina, 3-1, last night behind two goals from Vampeta in the first World Cup qualifier meeting between the world powers in Sao Paulo, Brazil. It was the first loss for Argentina (5-1) in qualifying for the 2002 tournament.

docs.snippet: Executives at four agencies are changing posts.    Roberta Garfinkle, one of the best-known media directors specializing in print, is leaving her position as senior vice president for strategic print services at Universal McCann in New York, part of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Executives at four agencies are changing posts. Roberta Garfinkle, one of the best-known media directors specializing in print, is leaving her position as senior vice president for strategic print services at Universal McCann in New York, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.
docs.abstract: Executive changes are announced at Universal McCann in New York, Mediasmith, DDB Latin America and GCI Group (S)

docs.snippet: In a time when full-time academic appointments are hard to come by, some mathematics Ph.D.'s may consider the career path taken by Dr. Charles Brenner, 55, one of the world's first fully employed freelance mathematicians.    Dr. Brenner calls himself...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a time when full-time academic appointments are hard to come by, some mathematics Ph.D.'s may consider the career path taken by Dr. Charles Brenner, 55, one of the world's first fully employed freelance mathematicians. Dr. Brenner calls himself a forensic mathematician and his business card reads, ''Charles H. Brenner, Ph.D., Aphorisms, Inferences and Conclusions From Thin Air.''
docs.abstract: Interview with Dr Charles Brenner, a freelance 'forensic' mathematician, who helps scientists do the statistical calculations necessary to analyze DNA evidence and also advises in paternity cases; photo (M)

headline.main: A Math Sleuth Whose Secret Weapon Is Statistics

docs.snippet: Returning to action after a long absence because of back problems, 39-year-old Lothar Matthaus proved that he can still be one of the MetroStars' best players when he is healthy. Conversely, his teammates showed Matthaus in the 2-1 overtime victory...
docs.lead_paragraph: Returning to action after a long absence because of back problems, 39-year-old Lothar Matthaus proved that he can still be one of the MetroStars' best players when he is healthy. Conversely, his teammates showed Matthaus in the 2-1 overtime victory over New England on Saturday that they are a good team, and his criticism of the club in the German news media early in the season may have been justified then, but is certainly not now. The MetroStars were 3-6 when Matthaus left in May to play for Germany in the European Championships. They will go into tomorrow night's game at Tampa Bay with a record of 14-9-2 and an 11-point lead in the Eastern Division. Quite a turnaround.
docs.abstract: Play of MetroStars soccer player Lothar Matthaus described (M)

headline.main: Difference in MetroStars Is Obvious to Matthaus
